title: Who was the last president to be elected without winning the largest share of the popular vote? - Quora
tags: Electoral College of the United States of America
Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Donald Trump. The popular vote favored Hillary Clinton by about 3 million votes nationally. George W. Bush also lost the popular vote in one election. In 1960 no one can proclaim with certainty who legitimately won either the popular vote or the electoral college.
Donald J. Trump in 2016, but if you meant before the current US presidency then it would be George W Bush in 2000 when Al Gore won the popular vote but lost the election.
